senses.de: Possible to achieve or to be expected based on facts or situations
senses.ex: It is not realistic to expect to learn English in two weeks.

Tips.title: Setting Expectations
Tips.description: Focus on setting goals that consider your current abilities and available resources.
Tips.example: Having a realistic timetable for learning English will help you progress steadily.

Tips.title: Predicting Outcomes
Tips.description: Use 'realistic' when assessing the probable results of actions based on past experiences.
Tips.example: It's realistic to assume it will rain during monsoon season.

Tips.title: Avoid Overoptimism
Tips.description: Prevent overly optimistic views that don't account for potential difficulties.
Tips.example: Be realistic; learning a new language can be challenging.

senses.de: Copying or showing things exactly as they are in real life
senses.ex: Her realistic painting of a flower looks like a photograph.

Tips.title: Perception of Art
Tips.description: In art, 'realistic' describes work that captures the true appearance of objects or scenes.
Tips.example: The artist's realistic drawings appeared almost like photographs.

Tips.title: Detail Orientation
Tips.description: Appreciate the precision in artwork or descriptions that make them seem real.
Tips.example: A realistic depiction of a city street includes even the smallest details.

senses.de: Accepting things as they are in fact and not making decisions based on unlikely hopes
senses.ex: We need to be more realistic about our budget.

Tips.title: Practical Decisions
Tips.description: Choose 'realistic' to describe decisions made after considering all facts.
Tips.example: They made a realistic plan for their small business to grow within a year.

Tips.title: Manage Hopes
Tips.description: Use 'realistic' for understanding limits and not expecting too much or too little.
Tips.example: Let's be realistic about the timeline; we can't finish the project in one week.

Achieve.wordDefinition:
Achieve means to accomplish or succeed in something, while the word realistic means practical or sensible considering the circumstances.

Achieve can be applied in situations where you want to accomplish a goal or complete a task, while realistic is applicable when you want to consider what is achievable given the constraints or limitations of a situation.

For example, if your goal is to lose weight, you can set achievable targets by making realistic changes to your diet and exercise routine.

Feasible.wordDefinition:
Feasible means something is possible to be done or accomplished, whereas realistic means something is possible to be done or accomplished in a practical way.

Feasible focuses on whether something is technically possible, while realistic focuses on whether it is practical or sensible.

For example, building a house on the moon is technically feasible, but not realistic because it would be too expensive and impractical.

On the other hand, starting a small business is both feasible and realistic because it can be done with a reasonable amount of effort and resources.

Feasible refers to technical possibility while realistic refers to practical possibility.

Logical.wordDefinition:
Logical means something that makes sense and follows a rational pattern of thinking. It refers to ideas and arguments that are based on reason and sound thinking.

In simpler terms, logical is about thinking logically and making sense, while realistic is about being practical and considering real-world circumstances.

Practicable.wordDefinition:
Practicable means that something is capable of being done or put into practical use. For example, building a bridge over a river may be practicable if there are enough resources and the technology exists to do so.

Both words relate to something being practical, but practicable specifically refers to something being possible to do, while realistic refers to something being sensible or practical in relation to the circumstances.

Practicable is often used in technical or engineering contexts, while realistic is used more broadly in everyday situations.

Practical.wordDefinition:
Practical refers to something that is useful or effective in real-life situations. It usually implies that something can be done or is achievable in a straightforward way, without being complicated or difficult.

For example, if someone is giving you practical advice on how to study for a test, they might suggest that you break the material into smaller parts and study each part separately.

So, in short, practical is applicable when talking about how to do something effectively, while realistic is applicable when talking about what is feasible or likely to happen in a given situation.

Pragmatic.wordDefinition:
Pragmatic means being practical and focusing on what is useful or effective in a situation. It is applicable when trying to find practical solutions to problems.

To sum up, pragmatic is about practicality, while realistic is about objectivity.

Rational.wordDefinition:
Rational refers to something that is based on reason and logical thinking, while the word realistic refers to something that is based on practicality and what is possible in the real world.

For example, if someone is trying to decide whether or not to go on a trip, a rational approach would involve weighing the pros and cons and making a decision based on logic.

Rational thinking is more focused on logic and reasoning, while realistic thinking is more focused on practical considerations and what is possible in the real world.

Reasonable.wordDefinition:
Realistic refers to things that are possible or likely to happen in reality, while the word reasonable refers to things that are fair or logical.

Meanwhile, it would be reasonable for a teacher to expect her students to turn in their assignments on time because that is a fair and logical expectation for a student in a class.

Realistic is applicable when we want to talk about what can feasibly happen in reality, while reasonable is applicable when we want to talk about what is fair and logical based on context.

Sensible.wordDefinition:
Realistic refers to something that is based on reality or facts and represents a true depiction of something. Sensible refers to something that is practical or reasonable and makes sense in a given situation.

For example, a realistic goal would be to study for two hours every day to improve your grades, while a sensible decision would be to save money and not spend it all on unnecessary things.

Realistic is applicable when trying to describe something that is true or factual, while sensible can be used when trying to make a practical decision or choice.

Viable.wordDefinition:
Viable means that something is capable of working or achieving success.

Realistic is often applicable when making a plan or setting goals, while viable is more applicable when evaluating solutions or ideas that could be used to achieve those goals.

quotes.Text: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Walt Disney

quotes.Text: The Soviet government is the most realistic regime in the world - no ideals.
quotes.Title: Israeli Leader
quotes.Name: Golda Meir

quotes.Text: Always go with your passions. Never ask yourself if it's realistic or not.
quotes.Title: American Speaker
quotes.Name: Deepak Chopra

quotes.Text: For us, it's always important to improve and keep things realistic.
quotes.Title: Spanish Athlete
quotes.Name: Hector Bellerin

quotes.Text: No realistic, sane person goes around Chicago without protection.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Saul Bellow

quotes.Text: We have to be realistic. If we don't win, life will continue.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: Hayden Fry

quotes.Text: Be safe and be realistic. They're both equally important.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Mick Foley

quotes.Text: The water in 'Life of Pi' is very realistic.
quotes.Title: American Producer
quotes.Name: Travis Knight

quotes.Text: It's unrealistic not to be able to indulge.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Hannah Bronfman

quotes.Text: I rarely get to be part of realistic films.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Biju Menon
